{"step_by_step_thinking": "According to the relevant documents, gap healing occurs when the fracture gap is 800 μm to 1 mm. In this case, the fracture is filled by osteoblasts and then by lamellar bone oriented perpendicular to the axis of the bone. This initial process takes three to eight weeks. Afterward, a secondary osteonal reconstruction is required to re-orient the lamellar bone longitudinally. Therefore, the answer is B. Woven bone formation replaced by lamellar bone.", "answer_choice": "B"}
